page.title: 02FARMING AROUND COMMONSIDE
page.content: THREE TENANTED FARMS CONVERGE IN THIS BLOCK. THEY ARE ALL PRINCIPALLY HILL & UPLAND FARMS THOUGH CROPS ARE GROWN ON THE LOWER SLOPES, BY THE RIVER TEVIOT, TO FEED THE LIVESTOCK IN WINTER. SILAGE IS THE MAIN WINTER FODDER. SOME HAY IS MADE. A FEW FIELDS OF BARLEY, WHEAT & OIL SEED RAPE ARE GROWN AS CASH CROPS. SHEEP & SUCKLER COWS ARE REARED. SHEEP ARE SHORN IN EARLY JULY, THE WOOL BEING BAGGED & SOLD TO THE WOOL BOARD. LAMBS ARE SOLD AS STORES (ie TO BE FATTENED) & FAT (ie READY FOR BUTCHERING) IN HAWICK & ANNAN. ONE FARMER HAS HIS OWN LORRY, THE OTHERS USE LOCAL HAULIERS TO TRANSPORT THEIR STOCK. BLUE-GREY HEIFERS ARE KEPT AS REPLACEMENT STOCK,ALL OTHER CALVES SOLD AS STORES IN HAWICK/ST BOSWELLS. HUGE NEW SHEDS HOUSE COWS & MACHINERY & REDUCE LABOUR. BUILDINGS WITH CART ARCHES CAN'T TAKE MODERN MACHINERY!
